meanings.definition: To be filled with wonder or astonishment.
meanings.sent1: She was marveling at the colorful sunset.
meanings.sent2: The children were marveling at the magician's tricks.
meanings.sent3: While marveling at the tiny ant, she accidentally stepped on it.
meanings.sent4: His ability to play the piano left everyone marveling at his talent.
meanings.sent5: The grand fireworks display had everyone marveling in awe.

meanings.definition: To admire or be amazed by something.
meanings.sent1: He couldn't help marveling at the intricate details of the painting.
meanings.sent2: The audience was marveling at the acrobat's incredible stunts.
meanings.sent3: She kept marveling at the adorable puppy in the pet store window.
meanings.sent4: The chef's culinary skills had everyone marveling at the delicious meal.
meanings.sent5: The stunning view from the mountaintop had them marveling at nature's beauty.
